content.description:
This is probably the least desireable of the routes in this area.  Still, its got some fun moves on the upper half.

Stick clip the first bolt, then do a tricky, insecure and reachy boulder problem to gain the slab.  Once on the slab, significantly easier moves climb the steepening wall to the anchor.
content.location: The furthest right route in the "Upper Remuda" group of routes.  Immediately left of "Wotai".

content.description: Stellar Wild Iris line.  Climbs up an easy left leaning crack before entering into the business on the face above.  Doesn't let off much from here to the anchors.  Great climbing.
content.location: Not immediately at the erratic, walk a few dozen yards down into the forest (trail doesn't stay next to the broken walls).  The next small wall holds Wotai and handful of other routes.  Wotai starts off of a large block at the base of the left leaning crack.  There is a runout 11b on the face to the right.  Also there are several slabby 10's and 11's on the small wall to the left, and just lower near the large boulders around the corner is the arete line that starts in the dihedral Medicine Man (11c).

content.description:
This line makes for a fine warm up, with relatively big holds on steep terrain.  However, the rock is not quite up to par for the area, and the movement is somewhat awkward.

Start on the left, slapping up opposing features to reach big edges over a rooflet.  Hidden pockets lead to the arching flaking, and an awkward lieback on big holds along this flake works up to easier terrain and the anchor.
content.location: The next route left of the classic "Wotai", climbing the east face immediately left of the buttress.

climbs.name: When I Was a Young Girl, I Had Me a Cowboy

content.description: Good stone, mostly pretty movement on a fairly steep wall.  Starts with inobvious bouldery crux on the many to choose from -- all face the wrong way small holds to a jug just above the 1st clip.  From here big movement on decent holds leads to a several cruxes up high.  You'll find one of the coolest slopers at Iris before the chains.
content.protection: 5 or 6 clips to anchors, possibly including lowering biners.  Clip initial low bolts to avoid being strung out to dry and possibly stick clip the low 2nd bolt.
content.location: Located on the main Erratic, just left of a trio or quartet of 14's.  Starts on the small sloping shelf on the left side of the wall.

content.description:
A houlihan throw is a type of lasso shot.

You can watch classic footage of Todd on this in  Masters of Stone I. Well worth digging out of the archives to watch Todd throw knives and hike Wild Iris testpieces.

Footage of local Chris Marley on a modern send:

vimeo.com/102864117
content.location: Furthest right route at the erratic, the traditional start is by stepping off the large boulder onto the face. The direct start has also been climbed.

content.description: Slightly under vertical face broken by two horizontals. Small holds between the horizontals bring the difficulty. Clamber to the top on jugs.
content.location: Left of the large dihedral that marks the start of Pale Face Magic.

content.description: Big obvious a-frame  roof in mo-town boulders. Long fun jugs to challenging end.
content.location: Walk down from "medicine man" on faint trail and you should walk around a bend and see the obvious roof, it's big. Problem starts low as possible on jugs on right end of roof. Make fun moves up and exit right.

content.description:
This route is amazing! Roof is challenging.

Note that the 2015 guidebook incorrectly shows this route as going straight up through the roof. This route is "Out to Pasture," 14b.
content.location: This route starts in the crack feature in the middle of the 5.12 wall. After the first 4 bolts, move right to finish on "Fat Bottom Girls," 12d. Going straight up is "Out to Pasture," 14b.

content.description: Hard moves off the ground lead to flakes and pockets on low angle terrain. Finish with multiple bulges.
content.location: Right side of the Rodeo Queen wall.

content.description: Pocket Pulling through a high bulge. Fantastic warm up route with obvious Wild Iris style. Instant classic of it's grade.
content.location: Left of Big Medicine. Nearing the end of the Erratic. Freshly bolted, not even in the 2015 guidebook

content.description: Interesting start, leads up seam and then out into pockets . Really fun crux to fun bulge/roof finish. A bit dirty at the anchors .
content.location: Located down and around the bend from "medicine man" follow faint trail down into boulders and pop out under the big buttress.

content.description: Pale Face Magic is a great line of slightly overhanging jug pockets, guarded by a tricky slab start.  The first few slab moves can be avoided by stemming up the chimney on the left, but either way the crux comes linking from the first flake to the second to reach the second bolt.  Although small, fortunately the holds through this section are not sharp.  Above, hero pulls on sinker pockets lead up the ever-steepening wall to the anchor.
content.location: Second route from the left end of the Erratic warm up area, just left of "Big Medicine".  Note this area is referred to as "The Upper Remuda" in "Lander Rock".

content.description: Climb the crack feature in the middle of the 5.12 wall to a stance beneath the large roof. The crux seems to revolve around a poor right hand 3-finger undercling and launching to a lone pocket high on the face.
content.location:
Start in the crack feature in the middle of the 5.12 wall and go straight up through the roof. This route shares the start with "Rodeo Queen" but finishes straight up (Rodeo Queen breaks right at the fourth bolt).

Note that the 2015 guidebook does not contain this route and incorrectly shows "Rodeo Queen" 12b as going straight up through the roof. The 2018 guide is updated and correctly displays both routes.

content.description:
dpmclimbing.com/articles/viâ¦

vimeo.com/47251076

vimeo.com/71587755
content.location: R of Heart Full of Ghosts, L of Throwin' the Houlihan

content.description: The upper part of this line makes the funky slab moves down low worth it. The crux involves an awkward/tenuous move through a pinch and some stuff that faces the wrong way. Push through the grunge and you'll be rewarded with 5.8 pocket nirvana. Worth the challenge if you're kicking around the area.
content.location: Slab just right of the route, Big Medicine

content.description: A fun line but quite sharp, do it when you have fresh tough skin - not a good 3rd day on route!  Climbs easily up the dihedral, gradually easing right onto the arete.  Prepare for the crux when you are fully on the arete and making a long move.  Powerful and possibly dynamic.  Fun despite the pain.
content.location: Located down and around the corner from the handful of routes near Wotai.  You'll be scrambling around a few large boulders to get to the flat base near the dihedral immediately left of the blunt arete that is Medicine Man.

climbs.name: I'm a Lead Farmer, Motha' Fucker

content.description: A boulder problem start leads you left into a steep flake and jugs to the top.
content.location: Starts in front of a boulder and pine tree just right of Medicine Man (5.11c).

content.description: A long, savage boulder problem involving lots of long pulls on one finger pockets.
content.location: L. of Moonshine, R. of Young Girl

content.description: Up the rail on Moonshine for two bolts then move left into Heart Full of Ghosts.
content.location: Located on the blunt arete of the Erratic main wall, start is directly left of Throwin' the Houlihan and right of Heart Full of Ghosts.

content.description: Route furthest right on the queen buttress. hard 2-4 clip and repoint finish. really really great stone.
content.location: walk down hill past medicine man , look for the obvious giant bulge/roof.

content.description: A rad little route on the Erratic. Powerful, very sustained, and enjoyable the whole way on underclings, pockets and a few edges. Doesn't give up 'til the very last move. A little easier than it's neighbor 'Young Girl' and just as good!
content.location: just left of 'When I was a Young Girl, I had me a Cowboy' 13a

content.description: Climb the long face that ends just to the right of the main 5.12 wall roof. End up a bulge into a sort of notch feature at a mega anchor.
content.location: The rightmost line on the wall of 5.12s that go out the large roof.

content.description: Climb the "blood orange" colored lichen face just left of 'Queen of Hearts'. The bottom half is very crimpy and atypical of Wild Iris. After the crimpy crux, climb on pockets and surpass a fun bulge with an easy roof finish above.
content.protection: Bolts with steel permas at anchor.
content.location: Left of Queen of Hearts.

content.description: Fun route that is worth doing. Slab crux low to fun and steeper pocket pulling up high.
content.protection: Bolts to a a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Find the grey slab of rock on the wall to the left of Wotai. Big Medicine is the middle of the routes on this wall (Pocket Hero is immediately to the left and Pale Face Magic is around the corner to the left on the same formation).

content.description: Start the same as Medicine Man in the stemming dihedral, but instead of straying right, continue up the left-facing steep headwall. Here you'll find an exciting power endurance finish on better-than-it-looks rock.
content.location: Start the same as Medicine Man, around the corner and down the hill from the main Erratic alcove.

content.description: Start on some thin crimps and edges, go up and traverse left into an undercling.
content.location: Left of Wotai
